metadata.Title: CVE-2017-18265 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: Prosody before 0.10.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash), related to an incompatibility with certain versions of the LuaSocket library, such as the lua-socket package from Debian stretch. The attacker needs to trigger a stream error. A crash can be observed in, for example, the c2s module.

criterions.comment: prosody: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
